Gary Dauphin http://www.kcet.org/cgi-bin/mt/mt-cp.cgi?__mode=view&blog_id=92&id=23
Local Heroes

Black History Month

In our ongoing commitment to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve, KCET and Union Bank honor local heroes of the African American community for their dedication and commitment to enrich the lives of others.

Meet the 2011 Local Heroes!

    ]]>     June Primetime Schedule PDF and More tag:www.kcet.org,2010://92.22312 2010-06-11T03:11:13Z 2010-06-11T04:00:35Z Attention, schedule fans: the June Primetime schedule pdf is now available! KCET Site Staff http://www.kcet.org/cgi-bin/mt/mt-cp.cgi?__mode=view&blog_id=92&id=195 Attention, schedule fans: the June Primetime schedule pdf is now available! Click here to download it, but, moving forward, it will also always be available at the top of our main online schedule.

    One of the most consistent - and passionate! - requests we've gotten over the course of our redesign is for a regularly published primetime schedule PDF. We're working hard to bring you these regular PDFs and will publish them to the site as they become available. In the meantime, though, we've introduced two new ways for you to keep track of our schedule:

    • Today's Schedule - Want to see today's schedule in fast-loading page?
    • Monthly Primetime Highlights - A fast loading view of the month's primetime schedule

    Because our broadcast schedule occasionally changes over the course of the month, our online schedules are the most accurate, most up-to-date views of our listings available.

    Let us know if you have any questions in the comments below.

    ]]>     KCET Social Media tag:www.kcet.org,2010://92.21042 2010-05-10T21:52:41Z 2010-05-10T22:38:49Z Connecting with KCET is no longer limited to flipping on the tube. Whether it's Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, or Flickr, we're always hooked in, and we'd love you to join. KCET Site Staff http://www.kcet.org/cgi-bin/mt/mt-cp.cgi?__mode=view&blog_id=92&id=250 Connecting with KCET is no longer limited to flipping on the tube. Whether it's Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, or Flickr, we're always hooked in, and we'd love you to join.

    Follow @KCET28 on Twitter, where we'll answer all your programming questions, provide you with primetime lineups, and link you to all sorts of related fun.

    Or open your eyes to the vibrancy of the city that surrounds you, from race and politics to arts and ideas, by following @SoCalConnected.

    KCET is also on YouTube, with videos that allow a glimpse into the behind-the-scenes of the station (on top of other bonus features).

    Enjoy beautiful photos of your city? Search through the SoCal Connected Flickr pool. And if you feel so inspired, maybe you'll even upload a couple snaps of your own.

    The KCET Facebook group helps make sure you never miss a beat, previewing the newest must-sees, as well as remembering KCET classics. And with podcasts and events intertwined, it's an essential for any fan.

    Check out KCET SoCal on Facebook, a portal into the many voices of the KCET blogging team. Filled with valuable insights and fascinating perspectives, these Angelinos will leave you thinking about your hometown just a tad differently.

    Lastly, remember that the award-winning SoCal Connected is on Facebook as well. These first-rate journalists have the airwaves abuzz, but did you know they're producing original online stories as well? Take a gander.

    ]]>     A Guide to the New KCET.org Schedule tag:beta.kcet.org,2010://92.20939 2010-05-06T19:36:24Z 2010-05-07T00:05:40Z Great news! KCET's new online schedule is easy-to-use and full of the information you need to enhance your viewing experience. With program information now always up-to-date, you can say goodbye to confusion. The KCET schedule page will now highlight a... KCET Site Staff http://www.kcet.org/cgi-bin/mt/mt-cp.cgi?__mode=view&blog_id=92&id=250 Great news! KCET's new online schedule is easy-to-use and full of the information you need to enhance your viewing experience. With program information now always up-to-date, you can say goodbye to confusion.

    The KCET schedule page will now highlight a Must See for you everyday, letting you in on all our can't miss favorites.

    Maybe you're trying to figure out what you'll be tuning in for this week? No problem. The schedule now displays the entire week in a single frame, making it easier to plan out the KCET portion of your life. And if you want to look even further into the future, click Select Date, which allows you to pick any date in the coming months

    If you're searching for show specifics, you're in luck. Clicking on a particular episode opens up to details and summaries. And if you want information on the entire show or its other airdates, click Visit Show Page and you'll be redirected to additional information.

    But above all else, we've made sure that our schedule caters to you:


    • Having trouble finding KCET on your television? Enter your zip code into Find the Nearest KCET Station to You and find out where to find us.
    • Easily switch over to the schedules of specialized KCET channels like KCET Desert Cities, KCET Orange or PBS World.
    • Quickly alternate between our prime-time schedule and what's on KCET right now.
    • Search KCET by genre, and allow yourself to find the type of programming you enjoy.


    And if what you really need is a simple PDF of the entire month's Full Schedule, we've got that too! Just scroll down to the bottom right corner, and it will be there waiting for you.

    ]]>     Welcome to the New KCET Video tag:beta.kcet.org,2010://92.20611 2010-04-30T19:54:47Z 2010-05-12T18:47:29Z Simple, quick, and to the point, KCET Video provides you with all your favorite KCET shows without any of the usual online hassle. Looking for an episode of Huell Howser? We've got it right here. Or maybe you're hoping... KCET http://www.kcet.org/cgi-bin/mt/mt-cp.cgi?__mode=view&blog_id=92&id=3

    Simple, quick, and to the point, KCET Video provides you with all your favorite KCET shows without any of the usual online hassle.

    Looking for an episode of Huell Howser? We've got it right here. Or maybe you're hoping to share a favorite SoCal Connected piece with a friend? That's no problem at all.

    Because KCET Video is easy and accessible, fun and free. We've even got all your PBS favorites, from Newshour and Frontline to NOVA and Wired Science. Missed last week's episode? Feel free to catch up on it here!

    Or search within our From the Archives section, a treasure trove of hard-to-find KCET programming. Who knows, maybe you'll unearth that classic piece from years ago.

    There's even programming only viewable online. Check out Departures, a KCET-original production that focuses on the many distinct neighborhoods of Los Angeles. You never knew there were so many different ways to live within a single city.

    And we're constantly compiling the internet's many fun and fascinating SoCal videos in our Video of the Day section. So check in daily, and discover how much you can learn - and how much fun you can have - in only a few short minutes at KCET Video.

    VIDEO INFORMATION: A decent connection and any computer made in the last five years is all that's needed to watch KCET videos. Videos are all 512x288 and uploaded as mp4 files.

    ]]>     KCET.org Events - Revamped, Rebooted! tag:beta.kcet.org,2010://92.20351 2010-04-29T22:00:30Z 2010-05-12T19:06:25Z Rejuiced and rejuventated, KCET Events provides you with all the ingredients to a great weekend in Los Angeles. Whether it's lectures, performances, festivals or something fun for the kids, it's all here in an easy-to-navigate fashion. KCET http://www.kcet.org/cgi-bin/mt/mt-cp.cgi?__mode=view&blog_id=92&id=3

    Rejuiced and rejuventated, KCET Events provides you with all the ingredients to a great weekend in Los Angeles. Whether it's lectures, performances, festivals or something fun for the kids, it's all here at KCET Events.

    And it's all here in an easy-to-navigate fashion. Looking for events in your area? Scroll down to the KCET Events Map--on the events homepage--and zoom into your neighborhood's upcoming events. Click on an event, and you'll be automatically redirected to the directions from your house.

    Or maybe you aren't constricted by geography, and need something tomorrow. Then scroll down even further and check out Events Around Town. Got a craving for something in particular? Click on 'Sort by Type', and customize events listings to your specific interests. Here at KCET Events, we cater to you!

    And don't forget about all our wonderful KCET-Sponsored Events. As many of you know, Cinema Series, Fine Cut, & Sesame Street Live have become as much a part of the KCET experience as our programming, and we want to make sure all you viewers are able to join in on the fun. Check back frequently, especially for those member benefits.

    So what's the main word to describe the new KCET Events section? That's simple: Simplicity. With dates, addresses, and prices right where you need them, and maps showing where you need to be, there won't be many questions besides, well, "Where do I sign up?"

    What are you waiting for? Jump on over, take a look through KCET Events, and let us connect you to this exciting metropolis. Hey, it'd be a shame to let so many wonderful events go to waste. Don't you think?

    Over the last few months we've been collecting your feedback about the KCET website - what you like, what you don't like, features you wish we offered, and so on. Please feel free to use this discussion board to give us your impressions, direct us to issues and bugs, and generally tell us how we're doing!

     ]]>     The New KCET.org! tag:beta.kcet.org,2010://92.20345 2010-04-29T19:00:16Z 2010-05-04T21:50:48Z We've launched a brand new site, but we need your help to finish it. Gary Dauphin http://www.kcet.org/cgi-bin/mt/mt-cp.cgi?__mode=view&blog_id=92&id=23 The KCET.org new media team has been working on a little project. Thousands of emails, hundreds of pages of documentation, many, many months of work, several focus groups, and a few fights later, we're ready to share. Welcome to the new KCET.org!

    Well, not quite. That should actually read: Welcome to the new KCET.org beta! Our goal throughout this process has been ambitious: rebuild KCET.org from scratch and, in the process re-imagine what a public television website can be. KCET's website (last overhauled in 2003) has to serve a broad range of constituents. These include viewers looking for schedule information, potential donors looking to support our work, parents and teachers looking for relevant educational programming, Southern California residents looking for best of breed public media content and so on. In terms of our operations, the station's website is a digital crossroads where the full range of the organization's activities meet - fundraising, communications, events, content production and distribution, programming support, community outreach, viewer services and more.

    Navigating that profusion of users - each with their distinct goals and needs - is not just a challenge, it's the challenge facing organizations like ours. We think that we've gone a long way towards meet that challenge through a new, easier to use look-and-feel as well as the addition of following new features:

    • Streaming video channels bringing you the best of KCET and PBS
    • An expanded and easier to use schedule
    • Over 9000 episode and show pages giving you in-depth information on every series and show airing on KCET
    • Extensive commenting, discussion and profile functionality that will allow you connect with others interested in KCET, public television and Southern California
    • Expanded events listings
    • Expanded content offerings bringing you stories, arts and issues from across Southern California: Departures, SoCal Connected, SoCal Voices and more
    • Easier ways to give and support KCET's mission

    But our work isn't done, though, and we need your help to finish it. As you page through the site we'd like you to leave your feedback about the new KCET.org - bugs & issues, things you like, things you don't like, features you wish we offered, and so on. We've created a special discussion forum where you can leave your thoughts, so head over and tell us how we're doing. This is your website as well

    Many thanks in advance!

    Gary - KCET.org Site Editor

    Go here to leave us feedback.

    ]]>
